alert.note: Alert for Kay; Noble; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 2:37PM CST until December 22 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the wind chill warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chill values as low as 20 to 25 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow reducing visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Kay, Noble and Payne Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight tonight to noon CST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 AM to noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 8 4 4 4 6 5 4 9 9 7. &&
